ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Loosen the knot in my tongue
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Remove the defect of my tongue
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and loosen the knot from my tongue
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “And untie the knot of my tongue.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And loosen the knot from my tongue,"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And loose the knot from my tongue,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Unloose the knot upon my tongue, t
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And loose a knot from my tongue,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Loosen the knot in my tongue,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And loose a knot from my tongue.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Remove the hitch from my tongue,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And remove the impediment from my speech,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And make loose the knot (the defect) from my tongue, (i.e. remove the incorrectness from my speech) [That occurred as a result of a brand of fire which Musa (Moses) put in his mouth when he was an infant]. [Tafsir At-Tabari, Vol. 16, Page 159].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Unloose the knot upon my tongue,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And untie the knot from my tongue.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And untie the knot from my tongue
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [20:27] And undo the knot upon my tongue — the result of his having been burnt by a live coal which he had placed [accidentally] in his mouth as a child;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And loose a knot from my tongue) loosen my tongue,
